channel.title: How am i lagging?
channel.description:
Hey guys, spent a fortune on my computer getting it running as smooth as possible on any game possible. Let's just say its been well over $1000. I recently installed an application on my C:\ drive. This brought all kinds of problems to it. Gave me over 5 trojans and 10 viruses. I completely wiped the application, and all of its data and ran Norton's security clean up over 5 times to completely rid the software from my computer in any form possible. Ever since i installed it though, my computer lags on EVERYTHING. I tried to play Minecraft, Lagged like hell. Tried to play Skyrim, never experienced so much lag in my life.
Do i need to upgrade my computer or maybe restore it? I'll leave it to the community to decide what i do. [img]http://i1276.photobucket.com/albums/y463/marinesboy12/MyProcess_zps56179784.png[/img]

item.description:
@MarinesBoy12 wrote:

Thank you everybody for the responses and suggestions I was able to fix everything by running a system refresh and a full scan+fix with Kaspy virus scan. (Norton sucks) haha.

Appreciate it very much everybody!!

item.title: How am i lagging?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Try a different anti-virus program. Norton isn’t exactly the greatest AV software. I use https://www.malwarebytes.org/ and it seems to work pretty well. Although the best advice I can give you is to never install a program that you aren’t 100% sure you can trust. If you follow that rule then the chances of you getting in this situation in the first place are a lot less likely

Read full topic

item.title: How am i lagging?

item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

Why so much ram for a rig I’m assuming is for gaming, I would think you only need that much if you are into a serious video editing and photoshopping.

Read full topic

item.title: How am i lagging?
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

Moparisthebest:

If it ran fine before a virus, and is messing up afterwards, it’s obviously a software problem or you still have a virus or something. You could try to remove it or fix the damage it caused, but a full format and re-install of windows is guaranteed to fix it.

With Windows 8 you can do a refresh, and keep all your documents (and settings?) without having to actually reinstall anything manually, it’s super handy!

And that probably is the best course of action if you can’t remove the virus/malware with any of the antimalware tools.

Read full topic

item.title: How am i lagging?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If it ran fine before a virus, and is messing up afterwards, it’s obviously a software problem or you still have a virus or something. You could try to remove it or fix the damage it caused, but a full format and re-install of windows is guaranteed to fix it.

Read full topic

item.title: How am i lagging?
item.dc:creator: @MarinesBoy12 MarinesBoy12
item.description:
@MarinesBoy12 wrote:

Ashi:

Probably a pórn virus.

Its not a “pórn” virus because i don’t watch the shit. I have a girlfriend so i don’t need to watch pórn to get myself satisfied.

[quote=“Tree, post:4, topic:544818”][quote author=MarinesBoy12 link=topic=663695.msg4435647#msg4435647 date=1405006262]
Really? Because it ran perfectly fine a month ago.
[/quote]

No, I’m kidding. That’s a lot of RAM. To be honest, it’s difficult for anyone to tell you what’s wrong with the limited amount of detail that you’ve given. You don’t need an upgrade and a ‘restore’ probably wouldn’t hurt. I’d personally wipe it, but I’m in a situation where all my data is safe anyway. I’m lazy too.[/quote]
I know i didn’t give much detail, but the lag problem began after the virus showed up from the installation of the application. That’s about the only thing i can think of that is causing the problem. I am probably going to do a system restore to see if maybe that could fix the problem.

vortex:

check your graphics card for any problems (overheating etc) and update your drivers, use the task manager to determine if any programs use excessive amounts of cpu and or ram and kill them, etc

I will try all these mothods and get back to you. I just want to get back to my smooth gaming. Desperate to fix this, haha.

Read full topic
